submission_info.submission_guidelines: Submissions must be prepared using the EPTCS LaTeX style.

submission_categories.description: Describe directions for research into Formal Methods for Autonomous Systems.
Describe well-defined research ideas that are in their early stages, particularly from PhD students.
Report on practical experiences in applying Formal Methods to Autonomous Systems.
Describe completed applications of Formal Methods to an Autonomous System.

summary.event: 7th International Workshop on Formal Methods for Autonomous Systems (FMAS 2025)

co_located_events.event_name: International Conference on Integrated Formal Methods (iFM) 2025

registration.info: At least one author per paper must register and pay for on-site attendance at FMAS.

summary.description: FMAS 2025 is a 2.5-day peer-reviewed international workshop that brings together researchers working on a range of techniques for the formal verification of autonomous systems.
summary.submission_details: Each submission will receive at least three single-blind reviews. Accepted papers will be published via EPTCS.
summary.publication_details: A journal special issue will be organised to collect extensions of papers accepted in FMAS 2025.
topics_of_interest: Applicable, tool-supported Formal Methods suited to Autonomous Systems
Runtime Verification approaches for the reality gap
Verification against safety assurance arguments or standards documents
Formal specification, modelling, and requirements engineering for autonomous systems
Case Studies identifying challenges when applying formal methods
Discussions on future directions of the field
summary.conference_scope: FMAS welcomes submissions that use formal methods to specify, model, or verify autonomous systems.
